page.title: 01LICHFIELD EAST
page.content: The area contains the eastern half of Lichfield,including part of Stowe Pool.Two of Lichfield's ancient churches,St.Michael's on the Greenhill and St.Chad's are within its boundary. Lichfield's main industrial estates are in the area,alongside the Stafford to London railway line.In the south of the area large tracts of farmland have been built-over within the last 5 years.Even so,8 of the 12 survey squares are still mainly farmland. A new by-pass road crosses the area from south-west to north-east allowing through traffic to avoid the city.The Coventry Canal runs from north to south through the east of the area.A small hamlet,Huddlesford,lies close to the canal in the south-eastern corner of the survey area.
